data.title: Hockey free agency
data.meta_description:
Brisebois was certainly not a #1 defenseman, but he was the best in town, so... On 2nd-3rd defensive unit, he can make a fine job.
J'te jure, j'aurais pris...
data.text:
A chart I made at GCF to track free agents.

Free Agent Movements

Red Text = Player leaving team/released by team

Green Text = Player joining team

Purple Text = Player placed on waivers

Blue Text = Trade

July 23, 2005

Philadelphia - Buy out contracts for John LeClair and Tony Amonte

July 25, 2005

Phoenix - Buy out contract on Brian Savage

Montreal - Patrice Brisebois released by team

Detroit - Place Derian Hatcher, Darren McCarty, and Ray Whitney on waivers

Los Angeles - Kings re-sign Luc Robitaille

July 27, 2005

Dallas - Team waives Pierre Turgeon

Dallas - Exercise option on Jaroslav Svoboda

Florida - Trade Darcy Hordichuk to Nashville for 4th round draft pick(2005)

NY Rangers - Team signs Al Montoya

Ottawa - Team exercises option on Dominik Hasek

Philadelphia - Sign Jeff Carter, Mike Richards, Triston Grant, and Alexandre Picard

July 28, 2005

Tampa Bay - Tim Taylor resigns with the team

Detroit - Brendan Shanahan exercises player option

St. Louis - Team exercises option on Patrick Lalime

Nashville - Sign Greg Johnson, Chris Mason, Vernon Fiddler, Libor Pivko, and Jerred Smithson.

Vancouver - Resign Wade Flaherty

Columbus - Pick up option on Radoslav Suchy

Colorado - Place Chris Gratton on waivers

Florida - Team buys out contract on Mathieu Biron

July 29, 2005

Calgary - Trade Mike Commodore to Carolina for 3rd round draft pick(2006)

Anaheim - Resign Sandis Ozolinsh

Anaheim - Acquire Todd Fedoruk from Philadelphia for a secoond round draft pick

NY Islanders - Resign Garth Snow

NY Rangers - Buy out contract of Bobby Holik

Buffalo - Dmitri Kalinin and Rory Fitzpatrick will remain with the team

Columbus - Bought out contract for Scott Lachance. Place Andrew Cassels on waivers

Minnesota - Bought out contract for Matt Johnson.

Minnesota - Resign Alexandre Daigle

July 30, 2005

Nashville - Trade Shane Hnidy to Atlanta for 4th round draft pick(2006)

Boston - Sign Mark Stuart and Andrew Alberts

Carolina - Trade Jeff O'Neill to Toronto for a conditional draft pick(2006)

Tampa Bay - Resign Ruslan Fedotenko

Anaheim - Trade Michael Holmqvist to Chicago for Travis Moen

Minnesota - Acquire Todd White from Ottawa for a 4th round draft pick(2005)

July 31, 2005

Dallas - Resign Sergei Zubov

Buffalo - Release Eric Boulton and Miroslav Satan(pronounced Shatan, not Satan )

Nashville - Agree to terms with Jamie Allison and Brian Finley

August 1, 2005

Edmonton - Trade Brad Isbister to Boston for 4th round draft pick(2006)

Florida - Sign Joe Nieuwendyk and Gary Roberts

Columbus - Resign Francois Beauchemin. Sign Adam Foote

Minnestoa - Sign Andrei Nazarov

St. Louis - Sign Aaron Downey

August 2, 2005

Chicago - Sign Adrian Aucoin

Atlanta - Sign Bobby Holik

Boston - Resign Glen Murray. Sign Shawn McEachern Agree to terms with Dave Scratchard.

Detroit - Resign Steve Yzerman

Philadelphia - Sign Derian Hatcher and Mike Rathje. Resign Chris Therien and Jon Sim.

Philadelphia - Trade Danny Markov to Nashville for 3rd round draft pick(2006)

Ottawa - Resign Denis Hamel

Florida - Sign Martin Gelinas and Joel Kwiatkowski

Calgary - Sign Tony Amonte

Carolina - Sign Cory Stillman

Los Angeles - Sign Pavol Demitra and Jason LaBarbera

Montreal - Sign Francis Bouillon and Peter Vandermeer

NY Islanders - Sign Alexei Zhitnik

NY Rangers - Sign Kevin Weekes, Martin Straka, and Marek Malik

St. Louis - Sign Trent Whitfield, Jeff Hogan, and Ryan Ramsey

Minnesota - Sign Roman Voloshenko

Phoenix - Resign Brian Boucher

Edmonton - Acquire Chris Pronger from St. Louis for Eric Brewer, Doug Lynch, and Jeff Woywitka.

August 3, 2005

Vancouver - Resign Markus Naslund

Dallas - Sign Martin Skoula, Vojtech Polak, Mathias Tjarnqvist, and Patrick Traverse. Resign Mike Modano.

Calgary - Resign Jarome Iginla. Resign Jordan Leopold

Pittsburgh - Sign Sergei Gonchar

Montreal - Resign Alexei Kovalev. Sign Mathieu Dandenault.

NY Islanders - Acquire Brent Sopel from Vancouver for a conditional draft pick(2006)

NY Islanders - Sign Miroslav Satan

Boston - Sign Brian Leetch

Columbus - Sign Brian Berard

Minnesota - Resign Manny Fernandez and Marc Chouinard

NY Rangers - Sign Martin Rucinsky

Edmonton - Trade Mike York and conditional draft pick(2006) to NY Islanders for Mike Peca

Philadelphia - Sign Peter Forsberg

Colorado - Sign Patrice Brisebois

August 4. 2005

Chicago - Sign Martin Lapointe and Jaroslav Spacek

Anaheim - Sign Scott Niedermayer. Resign Rob Niedermayer.

Buffalo - Sign Teppo Numinem. Resign Taylor Pyatt

Pittsburgh - Sign Andre Roy

Los Angeles - Acquire Jeremy Roenick and a 3rd round draft pick(2006) from Philadelphia for future considerations

Calgary - Resign Daymond Langkow

Carolina - Sign Oleg Tverdovsky

Columbus - Sign Martin Prusek

Boston - Sign Alexei Zhamnov

Detroit - Resign Chris Chelios

NY Rangers - Sign Ville Nieminen and Jason Ward

Colorado - Resign Alex Tanguay and Kurt Sauer

Washington - Acquire Chris Clark from Calgary for a conditional draft pick(2006)

Toronto - Resign Tie Domi

August 5, 2005

Vancouver - Resign Brendan Morrison

Chicago - Sign Nikolai Khabibulin and Jim Dowd

Edmonton - Sign Jussi Markkanen and Igor Ulanov

Colorado - Sign Brad May

Atlanta - Sign Eric Boulton

Washington - Sign Alexander Ovechkin

Nashville - Sign Paul Kariya

Toronto - Sign Jason Allison

August 6, 2005

Colorado - Sign Milan Hejduk

Pittsburgh - Sign Ziggy Palffy

Or if you prefer:

http://www.tsn.ca/nhl/feature.asp?fid=10407

http://www2.sportsnet.ca/nhl/free_agent_tracker.html

Sorry for the millions of hockey fans posting on CFC if I haven't posted that much in the incredible numbers of hockey threads we have going right now! Three!! Three hockey threads! What are we, european soccer fans?!

I should be glad the Leafs aren't doing so good, but the truth is, I wish Ferguson would have done more. If my beloved Habs are finally to finish before the Leafs in the standings and possibly beat them in a playoff confrontation, I want those damn dirty Leafs to be a strong team! Just like I want the Bruins and, to a lesser extend, the Sens to have good rosters and good systems.

Allison and Domi (!) are not the solution to Toronto's needs right now. Belfour sucks, Antropov could go to Russia, great prospects in the system are a rarity, O'Neil is a nice addition but won't be enough. Things could be worst though. Ferguson could sign Lindros and Leclair and have Quinn reform the Legion of Doom line!

Ottawa has done good. They're roster hasn't changed that much. The Dominator is still on board and the Sens are scary.

Boston is also looking strong. Leetch, Zhamnov, Scatchard, McEachern and Isbister and Glenn Murray signed with Boston. Those guys + Thornton, Samsonov, Bergeron and Raycroft = great games between the Habs and the Bruins!

Buffalo is disappointing. Numminen is a nice veteran, but Satan and Zhitnik were important parts of this team. yet, they are young and fast, wich is good news for any organizations.

The Habs have done good. Of course most hockey fans in town were hoping for more names, but I'm happy. Kovalev is a great hockey player and his play in the playoffs was tremendous(despite his famous faking accident in overtime against Boston). I'm not afraid of his lack of consistency. I think playing with regular line members as talented as Koivu and Zednik will mean sparks and points will follow.

We have tons of talented young players ready to step up in the big league. Guys like Andrei Kostitsyn, Chris Higgins, Tomas Plekanec, Alexander Perezhogin and Ron Hiansey could actually make the team this year. And guys like Ribeiro, Komisarek and Ryder are still really young. Theo is not too old, the same goes for Markov, Souray is in his prime and Dandenault will replace Breeze-by perfectly. I know I'm a huge homer when it comes to hockey so I have to say: The future looks good from here!

So the North-East division is looking good for next year. The New Rangers will sign some big names before the start of the season to make it more interesting.

This "new" NHL is crazy these days!

You need proofs? Karya will play in Nashvilel! How screwed up is that?

You gotta love it!
